title: Timeline / Activity Feed
description: Timelines are perfect for showing a sequence of events in chronological order, such as a project's history, user activity, or version updates.

overview.title: Overview of Timelines
overview.description: A timeline provides a clear, chronological visualization of events or posts. It's an effective way to tell a story or show progress over time. This example uses a vertical layout, which is common for activity feeds.

html.title: HTML Structure
html.description: An ordered list (`<ol>`) is used for the timeline, with each list item (`<li>`) representing an event. A border on the list creates the central vertical line. Icons are placed absolutely relative to each list item.

css.title: CSS Styling
css.description: The styling relies on relative and absolute positioning. The main line is a left border on the `<ol>` element. The icons or dots for each event are positioned absolutely to sit on top of this line, creating the classic timeline look.

js.title: JavaScript Logic
js.description: For a static timeline like this example, no JavaScript is necessary. In a dynamic application, JS would be used to fetch event data and render the list items into the DOM.
